name: Banks Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three fantastic nights at this wonderful hotel last week. From the moment we arrived we felt cossetted and cared for. Our room was a delight. In the past people have complained about steet noise, well what do you expect if you stay in the middle of a city. The room was a delight with a good shower, very comfortable bed and of course the free mini bar! The 'Living Room' - the reception area was extremely comfortable with a log fire - most welcome as the weather was not good. Once again the free bar was wonderful. Not just alcohol but being able to get a coffee at any time was great and the canapes that used to appear every eving were very much appreciated. . It was also a pleasure not to be charged for wifi and gave me the opportunity to use an Ipad for the first time. The hotel provides two Ipads and two desttops for clients use. All in all a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed in 2 rooms for 2 nights. One deluxe room with canal view was switched to a ground floor suite with view of air conditioning unit probably just about a fair swap.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good welcome and helpful staff, very clean rooms but small with little space to store your luggage. High spec but could do with bigger thicker towel and a little more light.
reviews.title: This is what 'Service' should be!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Interesting foyer with help your self area with good range of soft drinks, some beers, wines and spirits. Some cheese / biscuits and crisp there as well. It is not a huge area so felt a little claustrophobic as quite a few people here.
reviews.title: A hotel that meets every need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast limited continental buffet, sausages / bacon in a heater and eggs fried, scrambled etc to order. Could do with air extraction system as smells of frying.
reviews.title: A gem in the heart of Amsterdam - superkalafragalistic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night for my boyfriends birthday and we were disappointed. When we got there our room was not ready, then when we were given a room it was non-smoking when I specifically asked for a smoking room. So I had to traipse back down to reception to ask for the smoking room I had booked. When I got down to reception the extremely surly male receptionist said (with much sighing and eye rolling) that he would see what he could do, which I thought was a bit of a nerve since I booked the smoking room months earlier!
reviews.title: Not that great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I was waiting some people came in to try and book a room. The receptionist took one look at them and listened to their indian accents and decided they were not suitable, so he told them very rudely to leave and shouted at them when they protested. I was shocked and appalled by his attitude.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'living' space in reception is a waste of time as you aren't aloud to take drinks out of reception. We wanted to take our drinks upstairs to our room and were told we couldn't. It was my boyfriend’s birthday and we wanted to celebrate with some champagne in privacy. Apparently, that was too much to ask.
reviews.title: Nice
New Year
reviews.text: The breakfast the next day was a bit poor as well. Hardly any choice and felt more like a school canteen than a 4-star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole - i wouldn't go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — Location and free drinks and snacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a superb hotel that I actually booked before reading the reviews.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two excellent nights there on 22 and 23rd September 2006.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about Bank Mansion

likes.disliked: — Small rooms and queen beds ( NOT KING )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: All the previous reviews were spot on. From the moment we arrived the staff were so helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Banks Mansion-Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was perfect and the flowers I had ordered were in the room waiting (I have never seen such a fantastic bouquet).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — The free coffee, drinks and snacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fine and the complimentary drinks in both the room and the lounge area were an excellent idea.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else
Fantastic Banks Mansion!
reviews.text: Stayed at Banks Mansion for 3 nights on 25th August 06, for mine & husband's 10th wedding anniversary (without our kids hurray!! - thanks mum and dad for looking after them!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very excited about staying at the hotel, especially after reading so many positive reviews on trip advisor. Arrived after a short delay on our flight at around 7 pm, we were greeted by 'Nina' on Reception, who was very friendly. We were given room 201 which had a view overlooking the Herengracht canal, and our window was directly opposite the Mayor of Amsterdam's house!! Lovely room, large bed with a chair/footstool at the side. Nice shower-room in art-deco style with a lovely big shower cubicle. The shower leaked onto the floor each time so we had to make good use of the bath mat, but it wasnt worth complaining about! Loved the plasma tv on the wall, and the dvd player. Also enjoyed the free decanters of drink - gin, brandy and whiskey. We made it to breakfast 2 of our 3 mornings, very nice but found the girl who made the omelettes/french toast etc a bit stroppy. I think she was just a bit stressed as she had been left alone by her colleagues, but even so she was a bit rude! (I only asked if there was another loaf of bread as when we arrived in the breakfast room there was none!). (on Sundays the breakfast room is open until 11, we had arrived at approx. 10:20 - so obviously we expected to have bread available)! However, dont let this put you off, the hotel is great in general!
reviews.title: Very good, but not four star great.
You don't get much better.
reviews.text: We made good use of the 'living area' where they provide free coffee and pastries in the mornings, alcoholic drinks (more or less everything you can think of) and nuts/doritos/dips etc in the afternoon/evening. Oh, and free use of the internet if you need it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was in an excellent location, everything we were interested in seeing was within a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely meal (probably the nicest meal we've ever had - and we've eaten in a fair few restaurants!), at Casa di David which is located on the Singel, a 7 minute walk from Banks Mansion. To start we shared bruschetta with mozzarella and pesto - delicious. My husband then had a plain old spaghetti bolognaise - but said it was the best he'd ever eaten! I had kebabs of king prawn & poached salmon, on a bed of green beans with parmesan dressing - gorrrrgeous! This was served with saute potatoes. The food was lovely, the setting lovely, waiters very friendly, lovely atmosphere. (by the way we got Nina at Banks Mansion to reserve us a table as we'd tried to get in on the Friday night but couldnt).
reviews.title: Loved Banks Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and we definitely could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: The Best

likes.disliked: — Lack of a good room service menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff :
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and attentive. Henry, who was on duty when we arrived, saw us exiting our taxi and struggling with our luggage came outside to assist us. After insisting on taking our luggage to the room, he stayed and explained everything the hotel had to offer in detail. At dinner time we asked the clerk at the front desk about a good restaurant in the area and he directed us to a very good Italian restaurant on the corner, Point Arcata. They were also very helpful in assisting us when we had to ship some of our purchases home going so far as to packing them for us.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — The all-inclusive features as well as the quaintness of the hotel itself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Yes, it is that good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: Typical small European room but decorated very nicely. The bathroom was very large with a huge tub for relaxing in. Plush terrycloth robes and slippers are provided for you so all you need are your pajamas.
reviews.title: great hotel for tourists, ok for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looks great inside and out. Wonderful staff, Lovely clean rooms. Free drinks in rooms and also drinks and snacks in the lobby plus free internet access. The breakfast is worth having, again staff are frienly and plenty of choice and all taste good. The hotel is based in a quiet part of city but still close to everything. plenty of resturants and bars about.
reviews.title: Perfect !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a long weekend at the Banks Mansion and once again, the reviewers on Tripadvisor had it spot on. The location of the hotel is perfect and all the main spots within easy reach.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were received very well by very professional receptionists, in fact the service throughout our stay was exceptionally well, especially in a city not renowned for the friendliness of the service in general.
reviews.title: Congratulations !

likes.liked: — all included - open bar in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a room on the first floor with canal view. The room was not particularly large and for our taste a little too crowded with furniture, but I guess for Amsterdam it was acceptable. We were however told that the street view rooms, though cheaper, were larger but decided not to bother. I think if I went back to the Banks Mansion, I would go for a larger and less expensive street view room. The bed was ok, aircondition was appreciated in the heat of the summer.
reviews.title: Will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I agree with comments on the bathroom, nice but on the small side as well, the tabs were not user friendly.
reviews.title: The best in AMS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was absolutely wonderful. I will not repeat the detail posted by other users but to say the slightly higher price is more than worth it for the inclusive drinks, excellent staff and great breakfast (french toast to die for!)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not do enough for us and were genuinely friendly, the room was very comfortable and the location excellent. We will be back.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel if you can afford the rate

likes.liked: — Great staff and free booze and internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked directly over the internet a room with canal view which cost extra and is definitely not a budget price hotel, however, if it fits your budget We can thoroughly recommend it. our room was No 106 on the 1st floor and was decorated stunningly with 3 opening double tall windows looking out onto the canal and main street. Lovely decor, very comfy bed (2 very wide singles pushed together) air con, tv with 2 free porn channels 69 +70 (spice up your weekend - the dutch are definitely not prudes) a superb double size Rain shower and a bath, haidryer etc, plus FREE whisky, conyac and vodka in cut glass decanters and a mini bar stocked with smoothies, coca Cola, beer and fruit juices. That was just the beginning, the staff are so helpful and will recommend eating out etc based upon their experiences. Once you get your bearings you will soon find that you are located in an excellent location whether walking(as we did) or getting buses, taxis or trams. Some of the best places we went were The Ice bar (expensive but worth it) Ranchos Argentinian steak house, Red light district - you will be amazed (just window shopping) Anyway back to the hotel, the breakfasts were great, choice of cooked scambled eggs, bacon and sausage plus fruit, cooked meats, various breads for toast, or your own personally cooked omelette. And in the Living a lovely fire to chill out to when you returned to your hotel each evening with a FREE bar where you just help yourself to beer, wine, spirits and snacks (if there is a bottle that is empty just ask the staff and they will replace it with a full bottle) Then there is the free internet also in the living, by the time you add all the free booze and internet time you soon realise that although it seems a bit expensive when you first book when you check out and your bill is just the same as when you first booked that this hotel is a real find and is actually a bargain.
reviews.title: 2nd time around

likes.disliked: — The fact that I did not stay for longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know and will definitely stay here next time we visit Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Absolutely First Rate Hotel

likes.liked: — Super friendly staff, great rooms, free minibar/movies etc.

reviews.title: Great as a hotel with a difference.
reviews.text: I hope the other rooms in the hotel live up to room 106.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel enjoys a great location, and very easy to get to and from, tram stops just outside. Also, our concerns about transport were unfounded as Amsterdam has a very good, efficient, fast, cheap and regular system which makes life very easy.
reviews.title: Fantastic getaway!!!

likes.disliked: — Ask for a canal view room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Banks Mansion 31/3/12 for my wife's birthday, we arrive around 10am expecting to leave bags at reception and look around Amsterdam, but were told our room was ready and we
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: could check in, great start to a short weekend! Staff could not have been more helpful, providing
reviews.title: A great hotel for your Amsterdam visit
Very good in all regards
reviews.text: maps, and organising trips we required. the breakfast was outstanding, and the free bar in lounge was perfect to unwind after a day out and about. Most comfortable bed I have slept in. A great hotel, would return again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with my grandmother at the Banks Mansion Hotel from April the 5th to April the 8th. We arrived at 11 am, so we were prepared to wait an hour to get into our room. Very friendly concierge told us, that our room was already cleaned, so we were able to leave our luggage there and start to enjoy our trip. The rest of the hotel staff were just as nice, and every time we asked for something they were really eager to help us with our problem. We had a room with a canal view, though the hotel is now under restoration, so the view wasn't as excellent as we had expected. The location of the hotel is perfect, it's just between the Museumplein and the centre of Amsterdam. Also there's a tramstop almost in front of the hotel with two or three different tram lines. The only problem with the trams is that they are quite loud, and you can hear the traffic to some rooms, so if you're not a heavy sleeper, it's a good idea to bring earplugs. The room was big and clean, as was the bathroom. The bed was excellent, and they even had a pillow menu, where you can choose your like from 5 different pillow types.
reviews.title: The Delightful Banks Mansion Hotel-Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast fullfiled all our dreams. There was a cook who made fresh omelets and pancakes, fresh bread and many kinds of cheeses. Also there was a free self service drink bar in the lobby, and during the evening little snacks, like cheeses and candy and waffles.
reviews.title: Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel for 2 days in early April. The rooms are small but nicely decorated. Very friendly staff and the lounge area downstairs has free drinks and nibblies and free access to the Internet.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with Canal views

likes.liked: — Lounge with free drinks and nibblies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a recommendation to the Banks Mansion by our hotel clerk in the Hague. The big plus was that every service within the hotel is free. There was a lovely breakfast, in the dedicated room downstairs, with station for omelets, pancakes, etc., delicious breads, cold meats, salmon. In the late afternoon, the cocktail hour offerings included wine, beer, soda and little snacks (nuts, olives, chips). There were also copies of many
reviews.title: Welcome respite in busy Amsterdam

likes.liked: — The free breakfast and other services in the hotel and the location
likes.disliked: — Hotel desk wanted to send us to expensive restaurants (which we resisted)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: international newspapers, which along with the food, insured that there was a friendly busy quality to the confortably appointed hotel lobby in the late afternoon. The internet was also free access, including two computer stations.
reviews.title: Nice rooms ; unconvenient location ; unfriendly staff

likes.liked: — free minibar and hotel bar; rooms, bath-rooms
likes.disliked: — staff, location, no parking garage, expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The entire hotel, which is small, a boutique hotel, four floors,
reviews.title: A safe bet

likes.liked: — The location and the open bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is decorated in the style of Frank Lloyd Wright's decorative stained glass, and geometric patterns. Many design details have been thoughtfully incorporated (an under sink night light in the bathroom, for example; lighted cabinets). The room rate was slightly higher than our normal budget (229 Euros per/night), but we found the extra offerings plus the desk hospitality and advice about the city well worth the higher rate. We were given a corner room which overlooked the street, with an oblique view toward the famous Herengracht canal. Great peaceful location! Given the many warnings about the difficulties of finding a good hotel in Amsterdam, this one was a quiet and comforting place to land at the end of much walking and museum visits in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Great Service and Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location and very good service. Staff is ready to help and support the guest's needs.
reviews.title: A very good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary room frigo bar and the complimentary snacks and beverages in the hall have been highly appreciated.
reviews.title: Excellent service and good value!

likes.disliked: — Some of the decor a little OTT. Smoking allowed in hotel lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very comfortable and quite (mine was on the back).
reviews.title: Fantastic City Centre Hotel

likes.liked: — No nikel and diming; stylish rooms and bathrooms; city centre location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the room price and 2 computers with free access to internet are available in the hall. Other hotel consider these services as extra.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Comfort of the rooms and the complimentary breakfast, snacks & beverages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this hotel,the staff is very warm and friendly.Can't wait to go back!!!!
reviews.title: A home aeay from home....

likes.liked: — The lobby with the free coffee and spirits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is everything we expected it to be. The staff are courteous, it is situated in a great area, round the corner from some good restaurants (we highly recommend Teppanyaki Nippon Japanese Grill on Reguliersdwarsstraat, just round the corner) and within easy walking distance of most places to see.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is excellent,, everywhere is spotlessly clean and particularly the lounge area is comfortable and has a very relaxing ambience. You can help yourself to drinks and snacks at any time of the day, which adds to the overall atmosphere of luxury.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Fabulous
reviews.text: Breakfast is fabulous with a chef on call to do fresh omelettes, porridge etc at your desire.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't recommend this place enough. Its price totally justifies the whole experience of a stay here.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is the only city hotel I know that offers all drinks included in the price. It really is a nice touch and I had friends staying in another hotel who was allowed to sit and have a couple of drinks while I got ready for dinner. No chage they told me. Very nice staff.
reviews.title: The perfect place for family, friends and colleauges

likes.liked: — Fantastic room and free open bar
likes.disliked: — Wish they had an evening restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all lovely, breakfast was great, the free bar is a lovely idea and the shower was fantastic. Next time I will make sure I book a bath, but that is my only gripe. We had booked a canal view room, but whilst that sounds nice we were out and about, walking around the canals. Maybe its a good idea to ensure that the room is quieter.
reviews.title: loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location was excellent, within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. The walking also helped stave off the inevitable weight gain that follows too many pancakes.
reviews.title: Banks Mansion -- sometimes two stars, sometimes four

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love this city and visit every year. Next year we'll definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - with complimentary perks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights in July at the Banks Mansion. Staff could not have been more helpful. Nice, relaxing ambiance. Very friendly. The location is central but still removed enough from the frenzy of the city center. Rooms are clean, very comfortable and canal side rooms have great views. The hotel has been decorated with care. Really one of the nicer hotel experiences we have had in a long time. Staff seemed completely dedicated to service and were exceptionaly helpful.
reviews.title: Terrific small hotel

likes.liked: — Great staff, comfortable and sophisticated environment, close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in this hotel on three occasions and it has never disappointed. It's comfortable, classy without being pretentious, and each time the staff have been very helpful. But the best thing of all is that drinks and snacks are absolutely free. At first we couldn't quite grasp the idea that a hotel would give you free drinks in your room (yes, including alcoholic ones) and a wide range of free drinks in the 'Living' area downstairs, including wines, beers, soft drinks and coffee, supplemented by a range of nibbles that changes over the course of the day. I've noticed that other Carlton hotels don't do this - it seems that only in Amsterdam do they trust guests not to abuse the privilege. It makes for a very relaxing experience. The hotel really is everything it says on its website.
reviews.title: One of the few hotels worth repeated visits in Amsterdam

likes.liked: — The free drinks and snacks available all day.
likes.disliked: — I honestly can't think of anything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out we were made most welcome, and nothing we asked of the staff was a problem, the rooms were of an excelent standard, breakfast was good, and we enjoyed the whole experience.
reviews.title: Banks Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We definetly intend to go back, and I would have no problem recomending the hotel to others.
reviews.title: Thank you Tripadvisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read all the relavant reviews on tripadvisor and decided Banks Mansion would suit us. It was a lovely experience. From check-in the staff are lovely - its like staying with friends. The lounge is like a comfortable airline business class lounge with coffee, tea, wine, snacks, spirits, chocolates and sweets. Free mini bar in the room. Room was perfect, taps in the bathroom I agree with others are funny but not serious Breakfast was a great selection of proteins and carbs. Nice situation will stay again. They have scooter hire for those interested. Very clean. Loved it.
reviews.title: An excellent precruise stay

likes.liked: — The fact we did not have an extras bill
likes.disliked: — A bit disconcerting when you first arrive until you get some luggage help

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent five nights at this hotel last week and have only good things to say. It is in a great location..walking distance to everything. Great staff, clean, comfortable room (212) with big bathroom (separate shower and large tub). Breakfast included - nice selection with made to order eggs and pancakes - more like crepes but delicious. Nice to go back to the hotel after walking for hours and have a glass of wine with some appetizers. And the wine was not bad! I had initially wanted to stay in a canal house to really get the flavor of the city but wanted one that included breakfast and couldn't find that. I also usually stay in a smaller, more boutique style hotel. However, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An unexpected treat! Upon arrival we were granted a free room upgrade- to the third floor corner room overlooking the Herengracht canal. The hotel was perfectly located for exploring the city on foot. During our stay in Amsterdam the weather was quite chilly. Since this hotel was so centrally located we were able to stop back into our hotel in the middle of the day to put on more layers, warm up, and enjoy a free espresso or cappuccino from the 'living room' of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night we would relax in the 'living room' with a free drink and a snack that the hotel provided. At the hotel we were also able to buy tickets for the canal tours, Anne Frank House, trams, etc. The room was excellently clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was a a menu to order pillows to your liking each night. This hotel is also very close to a stop for the tram which is a quick ride anywhere in the city, especially Centraal Station.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was warm and welcoming each time we entered the hotel. The breakfast was delicious each day, and the staff in the kitchen was also very friendly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest this hotel to anyone traveling to Amsterdam!
reviews.title: Classy Hotel
Good location, great staff
reviews.text: Niice breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small rooms. A/C worked well.
reviews.title: Ummmm....don't understand why it is a top 25 hotel In Amsterdam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extra price for room canal side was not worth it as it only had French balcony.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Room price for all rooms included open bar all day and small snacks.  At about 5 they put out cheese and crackers. Rooms also included water, liquor and limited sodas.
reviews.title: Perfect stay with amazing staff and unbeatable value if you take advantage of all the extras. Will return and recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WiFi, two PCs and iPads in living room
reviews.title: Not during Queens Day Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the Banks Mansion and what a treat!! It was very clean and close enough to all the major attractions. The room was small but what room isn't in Europe. The bathroom and room was clean and comfortable and that was all that mattered. Also, the free mini bar and breakfast in the morning was awesome. I would definitely stay at the Banks Mansion again.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 night at end of aug 08
reviews.title: A Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Did a lot of searching on trip advisor first.
reviews.title: What a great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a good location I had looked at dam square originally for accomodation and was put of by the likely noise and was right to stay a little further away from the square.
reviews.title: Perfect for a weekend away

likes.disliked: — housekkeping knocking on our door at 9.45am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we walked from central station to the hotel took 30 mins however taxi is less than 10 euro. trams stop very close to hotel also.
reviews.title: Somewhere special

description: Exceptional Hospitality Founded on the concept of personalization our goal is to ensure that everything about your stay suits you. The intimacy of the hotel allows for greater personal attention, incredible service and an eye for detail by our staff. As a guest of Banks Mansion, at any given moment you are entitled to enjoy all of the beverages and appetizers offered to you in "The Living" along with complimentary breakfast, complimentary private in-room bar, complimentary in-house movies, complimentary Internet-access in our business corner and 24/7 free premium WiFi.
